intro: Centranthus calcitrapae f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered centranthus, is a rare and striking plant characterized by its pale white or cream-colored flowers. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is native to specific regions in southern Europe, particularly in rocky and arid habitats. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its unique floral display makes it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it is challenging to cultivate due to its specific environmental requirements.
